address.seedMissingEnv: The seed does not appear to be hex or base64, assuming it is an environment variable, but there is no environment variable with the name "{env}" set.
address.seedInvalidEnv: The seed does not appear to be hex or base64, assuming it is an environment variable, but there the environment variable is neither hex or base64. "{envValue}"
address.seedInvalidFormat: The seed does not appear to be hex, base64 or an environment variable. "{seed}"

mnemonic.description: Create a mnemonic, will also generate the equivalent seed in hex and base64 format.

strength.description: The number of words in the mnemonic, defaults to 256 which produces 24 words.

seed-format.description: The format to output the seed.

no-console.description: Hides the mnemonic and seed in the console.

json.description: Creates a JSON file containing the mnemonic and seed.

env.description: Creates an env file containing the mnemonic and seed.

address.summary: Create bech32 addresses and keys from the seed.
address.description: Create a number of bech32 addresses and their associated key pairs from the seed.

seed.description: The seed to use for generating the addresses, this can be either hex, base64 or an environment variable name. For an environment variable start the value with a !

start.description: The index of the first address to create.

count.description: The number of addresses to create, max 100.

account.description: The account used to generate the bech32 addresses.

hrp.description: The human readable part of the bech32 addresses.

coin.description: The coin type used to generate the bech32 addresses.

key-type.description: The type of key to generate.

key-format.description: The format to output the keys.
